</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="20%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: inline">819</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr bgcolor="white">
<td align="left" valign="bottom" width="75%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Removal of ARO for wells sold</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; TEXT-
ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="20%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; TEXT-
ALIGN: right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
DISPLAY: inline">(1,152</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; TEXT-ALIGN: 
left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">)</font></td>
</tr><tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
<td align="left" valign="bottom" width="75%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Asset retirement obligation &#8211; June 30, 2015</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">$</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="20%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">36,725</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: 
left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">11. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">In connection with the sale of the working interest in 
the Orogrande Project, 500,000 three year warrants to purchase common stock with
an exercise price of $2.31 were issued on July 1, 2015. Of the 500,000 warrants,
250,000 are exercisable on September 30, 2015 and the remaining 250,000 are 
exercisable on December 31, 2015.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Loan from Shareholder</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">On August 6, 2015 a shareholder advanced $250,000 to be 
repaid within 30 days from the proceeds of the sale of the Hunton properties or 
proceeds of a funding event. If repayment extends beyond 30 days 12% interest 
will apply retroactively from August 6, 2015.</font></font></div>
<br>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">14</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 
2.&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND 
RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; 
DISPLAY: inline">Basis of Presentation of Financial 
Information</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On November 23, 2010, the Share Exchange Agreement (the 
&#8220;Exchange Agreement&#8221; or &#8220;Transaction&#8221;) between Pole 
Perfect Studios, Inc. (&#8220;PPS&#8221;) and Torchlight Energy, Inc. 
(&#8220;TEI&#8221;) was entered into and closed, through which the former 
shareholders of TEI became shareholders of PPS. At closing, PPS abandoned its 
previous business. Consequently, as a result of the Transaction, the business of
TEI became our sole business.&#160;&#160;In addition to TEI, we also operate our
business through our subsidiaries Torchlight Energy Operating, LLC and Hudspeth 
Oil Corporation.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-
DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: inline">Summary of Key 
Results</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; 
DISPLAY: inline">Overview</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">We are engaged in the acquisition, exploration, exploitation, 
and/or development of oil and natural gas properties in the United 
States.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The following discussion of our financial condition and results
of operations should be read in conjunction with our unaudited financial 
statements included herewith and our audited financial statements included with 
our Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2014. &#160;This discussion should
not be construed to imply that the results discussed herein will necessarily 
continue into the future, or that any conclusion reached herein will necessarily
be indicative of actual operating results in the future. &#160;Such discussion 
represents only the best present assessment by our management.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">We had no active operations prior to the inception of TEI on 
June 25, 2010 and had limited revenues prior to the year ended December 31, 
2012. &#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-
DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: inline">Current Projects</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">As of June 30, 2015 the Company had interests in five oil and 
gas projects: the Marcelina Creek Field Development in Wilson County, Texas, the
Coulter Field in Waller County, Texas, the Ring Energy Joint Venture in 
Southwest Kansas, the Hunton play in partnership with Husky Ventures in Central 
Oklahoma and the Orogrande Project in Hudspeth County, Texas.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Marcelina Creek Field Development</font>.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On July 6, 2010, TEI entered into a participation agreement 
with Bayshore Operating Corporation, LLC (&#8220;Bayshore&#8221;), which is 
currently the holder of an oil, gas, and mineral lease covering approximately 
1,045 acres in Wilson County, Texas, known as the Marcelina Creek Field 
Development.&#160;&#160;The Participation Agreement provides for the drilling of
four wells. Three of the obligation wells have been drilled.&#160;&#160;The 
first three wells include a horizontal re-entry well known as the Johnson-1-H, a
vertical well known as the Johnson #4, and a lateral well known as the Johnson 
#2-H.&#160;&#160;These three wells are presently producing a total of 
approximately 80 BOPD.&#160;&#160;The remaining well is to be a vertical 
development well at a location to be determined within the existing lease. 
Drilling is anticipated in 2015.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Marcelina Creek Field Development is located over the 
Austin Chalk, Buda, and Eagle Ford Formations, which formations are well known 
and established producers in central Texas.&#160;&#160;Their production is 
controlled by vertical fracturing of the rock with high productivity in wells 
which encounter the greatest amount of fractures.&#160;&#160;With the advent of 
horizontal drilling technology, numerous opportunities exist in areas and fields
that were only drilled vertically.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Coulter Field</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">In January 2012, we entered into a farm-in agreement, titled 
the &#8220;Coulter Limited Partnership Agreement&#8221; (the &#8220;Coulter 
Agreement&#8221;), with La Sal Energy, LLC (&#8220;La Sal&#8221;).&#160;&#160;La
Sal owns a 100% working interest and a 75% net revenue interest in approximately
940 acres of oil, gas, and mineral leases in Waller County, Texas, on which the 
well known as &#8220;John Coulter #1-R&#8221; is located. This well is adjacent 
to the Katy Field, located on its northwestern updip edge, which produces 
primarily from the Wilcox Sparks formation.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Pursuant to the Coulter Agreement, we acquired a 34% working 
interest and a 25.5% net revenue interest from La Sal&#8217;s interest in the
John Coulter #1-R for the purchase price of $350,000, which was to be applied to
100% of the costs of a fracture stimulation treatment on the 
well.&#160;&#160;Under the agreement, we had options to purchase additional 
working interests up to a total of 45%.&#160;&#160;We exercised the first option
and purchased an additional 6% for $50,000, bringing our working interest to 40%
and our net revenue interest to 30%.&#160;&#160;Our option to purchase an 
additional 5% working interest can be exercised by the payment of $50,000 within
30 days of first commercial production from the well.&#160;&#160;If commercial 
production is established, the net revenue split will be 80% to us and 20% to La
Sal until net revenue totals $437,500, after which the net revenue will be split
according to the interests in the </font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">well.&#160;&#160;Expenses above the 
initial $350,000 will be split according to the working interests in the 
well.&#160;&#160;Our total investment in the project, including fracture 
stimulation, subsequent testing, purchase of additional interests and 
capitalized interest, amounted to $696,948 as of June 30, 2015.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">15</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 2.&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF 
FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS </font><font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; DISPLAY: inline">- continued</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">The 
Coulter is a non-core, non-producing asset which we will attempt to monetize by 
sale of the lease. We presently have approximately 940 acres.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Smokey Hills Prospect, McPherson County, Kansas</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">In April 2013, we entered into an agreement to acquire certain 
assets of Xtreme Oil &amp; Gas, Inc. of Plano, Texas 
(&#8220;Xtreme&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Included in that agreement were the Smokey 
Hills Prospect in McPherson County, Kansas, the Cimarron Area Hunton Project in 
Logan County, Oklahoma,&#160;&#160;and an interest in a salt water disposal 
facility in Seminole, Oklahoma.&#160;&#160;Total consideration for all the 
properties was $1.6 million.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Smokey Hills acquisition included approximately 16,000 
gross acres and a well, the Hoffman 1-H within the greater Lindsborg Field 
area.&#160;&#160;Our working interest is nearly 18%.&#160;&#160;Wells had been 
drilled vertically in the 1960&#8217;s to present at depths of less than 4,000 
feet looking for production from Mississippian carbonated fractured 
reservoirs.&#160;&#160;The Hoffman well was drilled laterally 4,200 feet and 
fracking had not been completed at the time of our acquisition of the 
project.&#160;&#160;Core analysis and logs indicated good porosity at 14 to 22%.
Following our acquisition, the well was hydraulically fractured, but the results
were disappointing.&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">During 2014 a ten well program to evaluate the Prospect was 
conducted. Based on the economic outcome of the first five wells and the further
geological analysis of the acreage, the drilling program was discontinued during
the fourth quarter, 2014 and the two producing wells were shut in.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Smokey Hill project was sold in second quarter, 2015 for 
$65,000.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline; DISPLAY: inline">The Ring Energy Joint Venture, Southwest 
Kansas</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">In October 2013, we entered into a Joint Venture agreement with
Ring Energy.&#160;&#160;The agreement called for us to provide for $6.2 million 
in drilling capital to, in effect, match Ring Energy&#8217;s expenditures for
leasing.&#160;&#160;In exchange for this commitment, we would receive a 50% 
interest in each well bore drilled and the acreage unit it held, until we had 
spent $6.2 million.&#160;&#160;At such time, we would then receive a 50% Working
Interest in the entire lease block consisting of 17,000 +/- acres.&#160;&#160;We
were to provide $3.1 million in advance of the program commencing, which would 
cover approximately 5 wells to be drilled and completed.&#160;&#160;Once the 
initial five wells are completed, we and Ring would evaluate the program and the
drilling activity and determine if another five wells are to be 
drilled.&#160;&#160;Should we continue with the program, we would then deposit 
another $3.1 million with Ring for drilling and completion of the next five 
wells.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">We have made the initial $3.1 million deposit and the first 
five well drilling program is completed. Drilling operations commenced in March,
2014. Seven wells have been drilled &#8211; three are producing, one can be 
converted to a salt water disposal well, one was not completed, and two were 
plugged and abandoned.&#160;&#160;Based upon results from drilling, the 
participants elected to suspend further drilling and obtain seismic data to 
guide continuing development. The seismic data is being analyzed at the date of 
this filing.&#160;&#160;&#160;As of June 30, 2015, the Company had invested 
approximately $5,325,000 in the Ring Joint Venture.&#160;&#160;The Company 
believes this project is still considered to be in the testing 
phase.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Hunton Play, Central Oklahoma</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Xtreme transaction also included the acquisition of three 
Hunton wells, the Hancock, Robinson and Lenhart.&#160;&#160;The Hancock and 
Robinson were producing wells but had small working interests of 1% and .25 of 
1%, respectively.&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Lenhart Well</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Lenhart well is a 62% working interest and was being 
prepared for a fracture stimulation when it was previously damaged, prior to our
acquisition, by the service contractor.&#160;&#160;The well bore at the Hunton 
level has an irretrievable pipe in the hole and cannot be used to produce from
the Hunton.&#160;&#160;Although Xtreme won the litigation against the 
contractor, he failed to pay for the replacement of the well bore, and Xtreme 
was responsible for costs primarily to Baker-Hughes for work done on the 
well.&#160;&#160;We took responsibility for those charges and negotiated a 
settlement of approximately $600,000.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Subsequent to the above, we have identified a shallow sandstone
that could potentially be productive.&#160;&#160;As previously planned, we 
tested this formation, and although there were hydrocarbons present, they are 
not in sufficient quantities to be economic.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Lenhart property was sold for $25,000 and buyer&#8217;s 
assumption of plugging liability in 2015.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Hunton Properties</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">During the second quarter of 2013, Torchlight entered into an 
agreement with Husky Ventures to participate in the drilling of wells to the 
Hunton Formation in central Oklahoma. We continued to expand this relationship 
with Husky Ventures on a monthly basis as we expand our lease acreage in the 
contracted Areas of Mutual Interest (AMI&#8217;s).</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">16</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 2.&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF 
FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS </font><font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; DISPLAY: inline">- continued</font></font></div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">When Torchlight executed the agreement Husky had already 
drilled and completed 18 successful wells in the Hunton.&#160;&#160;We estimated
that Husky had spent, or caused to be spent,&#160;$125 million in what we 
considered a Research and Development project.&#160;&#160;The results of 
Husky&#8217;s initial program lead them to develop certain drilling and 
completions techniques of which we could participate in and take advantage 
of.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The terms in our agreement with Husky are that we pay our 
proportionate costs of leases and operating expenses based on our working 
interest.&#160;&#160; For leasing and drilling costs (the AFE), we carry Husky 
for&#160;15% based on our working interest participation.&#160;&#160;This is to 
compensate Husky for the initial program mentioned above and, additionally, the 
project coordination of the geological, leasing, legal and title opinions, 
survey and permitting, all drilling, frac design, completion and equipping, day 
to day operations, and accounting and filing all required monthly and annual 
reporting to all governmental agencies.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">Torchlight believes this is an equitable agreement in 
that we have the benefit of the initial programs results while participating 
with a proven operator in areas that continue to provide us with outstanding 
results in a safe investment environment.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">Specifically, we were able to negotiate a 15% working 
interest in approximately 3,700 acres in the Cimarron Area of Logan County in 
May, 2013.&#160;&#160;Leasing continued monthly which resulted in the total 
acreage in which the Company has an interest increasing to approximately 5,020 
as of March 31, 2015 (Net undeveloped acres = 343). Our net cumulative
investment through June 30, 2015 in undeveloped acres in the Cimarron 
AMI&#160;was $715,596</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">The first well in the Cimarron AMI, the Boeckman #1-H 
well, was spud and was subsequently completed and fracture stimulated in July, 
2013.&#160;&#160; We acquired a working interest in the Boeckman #1-H well and 
subsequently sold part of our ownership in the Boeckman well for $990,000. We 
agreed to a preferential payout to the purchaser equal to 50% of his acquired 
interest.&#160;&#160;The agreement was amended in the first quarter of 2014 to 
include our agreement to advance funds under a note receivable from the 
purchaser to be repaid from the purchaser&#8217;s revenue preference subsequent 
to October, 2014.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">In the 
third quarter of 2013, we acquired from a third party for stock, a 15.3% working
interest in 5011+/- acres in the Chisolm Trail AMI with Husky Ventures Inc. as 
the operator.&#160;Leasing also continued monthly in this AMI increasing the 
total acreage in which the Company has an interest to approximately 15,300 as of
June 30, 2015 (Net undeveloped acres = 2,165).&#160; Our net cumulative 
investment through June 30, 2015 in undeveloped acres in the Chisholm Trail 
AMI&#160;was $4,429,248.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">In the 
fourth quarter of 2013 we entered into our third Area of Mutual Interest (AMI) 
with Husky Ventures, the Viking Prospect.&#160;&#160;This AMI covers four 
townships in size. We acquired a 25% interest in 3,945 acres in the Viking. We 
subsequently acquired an additional 5% in May, 2014.&#160;&#160; Leasing is 
continuing monthly so that we had an interest in approximately 7,735 total acres
in which the Company has an interest as of June 30, 2015. (Net undeveloped acres
= 2,266) Husky&#160;drilled the first two wells in the AMI in second quarter, 
2014.&#160; Our net cumulative investment through June 30, 2015 in undeveloped 
acres in the Viking AMI&#160;was $1,326,663.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">In January of 2014, we again elected to continue to 
expand in the Hunton Play with Husky Ventures.&#160;&#160;We contracted for a 
25% Working Interest in approximately 5,000 acres in the R4 AMI consisting of 
eight townships in South Central Oklahoma. We subsequently acquired an 
additional 5% in May, 2014.&#160; Leasing is continuing monthly so that the 
Company had an interest in approximately 11,900 total acres as of June 30, 2015 
(Net undeveloped acres = 3,586). Our cumulative investment through June 30, 2015
in the R4 AMI&#160;was $2,834,514.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">In February of 2014, we acquired a 10% Working Interest 
in a well in the Prairie Grove AMI from a non-consenting third party who elected
not to participate in the well. In July of 2014, we elected to further expand in
the Hunton Play with Husky Ventures.&#160;&#160;We contracted for a 25% Working 
Interest in the T4 AMI.&#160;&#160;There is an active ongoing leasing program in
this AMI so that&#160;the total acres in which the Company has an interest at 
June 30, 2015 totals approximately 2,325 acres (Net undeveloped acres = 581). 
Our cumulative investment through June 30, 2015 in the T4 AMI&#160;was 
$949,530.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">On April 8, 2015, we announced that we are seeking to 
divest certain of our Hunton assets located in Logan and Kingfisher Counties, 
Oklahoma.&#160;Negotiations for a potential sale are ongoing at this 
time.</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Salt Water Disposal Facility</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">As part of the Xtreme transaction we also acquired a 22.5% net 
royalty on a salt water disposal facility in Seminole, Oklahoma.&#160;&#160;No 
value was placed on the facility due to operational uncertainty.&#160;&#160;The 
facility which was newly commissioned in January 2013 is a state of the art 
disposal facility which can handle 20,000 barrels of produced and injected 
fluids per day.&#160;&#160;Oil and gas wells produce large quantities of 
saltwater that must be trucked and disposed of at a cost to the 
producer.&#160;In addition to the royalty, we had a 24.65% Working Interest 
which was acquired from some investors that have turned over their working 
interest in lieu of paying their outstanding JIB Account Receivable due to 
Torchlight, plus the right to an additional working interest of 37.5% when the 
original investors in the facility receive a payout of their investment. The SWD
facility was sold in the second quarter, 2015 for $300,000.</font></font></div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">17</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 2.&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF 
FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS </font><font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; DISPLAY: inline">- continued</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline; DISPLAY: inline">Orogrande Project, West Texas</font></font></div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">On August 7, 2014, we entered into a Purchase Agreement with 
Hudspeth Oil Corporation (&#8220;Hudspeth&#8221;), McCabe Petroleum Corporation 
(&#8220;MPC&#8221;), and Greg McCabe. Mr. McCabe was the sole owner of both 
Hudspeth and MPC. Under the terms and conditions of the Purchase Agreement, at 
closing, we purchased 100% of the capital stock of Hudspeth which holds certain 
oil and gas assets, including a 100% working interest in 172,000 mostly 
contiguous acres in the Orogrande Basin in West Texas. This acreage is in the 
primary term under five-year leases that carry additional five-year extension 
provisions. As consideration, at closing we issued 868,750 shares of our common 
stock to Mr. McCabe and paid a total of $100,000 in geologic origination fees 
to&#160;third parties.&#160; Additionally, Mr. McCabe will have an optional 10% 
working interest back-in after payout and a reversionary interest if drilling 
obligations are not met, all under the terms and conditions of a participation 
and development agreement.&#160; Closing of the transactions contemplated by the
Purchase Agreement occurred on September 23, 2014.</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Of the 172,000 acres, 40,154 were scheduled for renewal in 
December, 2014.&#160;&#160;The Company renewed the leases for the 40,154 acres
during second quarter, 2015. Prior to March 31, 2015, the Company had the 
obligation to begin drilling its first well in order to hold the acreage block. 
The well was permitted and spudded and drilling began by March 31.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company finalized an agreement to sell a 5% working 
interest in the Orogrande acreage on June 30, 2015 with an effective date of 
April 1, 2015. Sale proceeds were $500,000 which were received in April, 2015. 
In addition, the Company issued 250,000 three year warrants with an exercise 
price of $.50 to the purchaser.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; 
DISPLAY: inline">Historical Results for the six months ended June 30, 2015 and 
2014:</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Revenues and Cost of Revenues</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">For the six months ended June 30, 2015, we had production 
revenue of $1,042,827 compared to $2,273,005 for 2014. &#160;Refer to the table 
of production and revenue included below for quarterly changes in revenue. 
&#160;Our cost of revenue, consisting of lease operating expenses and production
taxes, was $510,544, and $576,235 for the six months ended June 30, 2015 and 
2014, respectively.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Results of operations for the six months ended June 30, 2015 
includes Impairment expense of $22,438,114 to recognize the impact of industry 
conditions (decline in oil price of $46 per barrel for the year ended June 30) 
on the carrying value of the Investment in Oil and Gas Properties on the 
Company&#8217;s Balance Sheet. The Impairment expense is substantially 
attributable to the Hunton properties in Oklahoma.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Impairment was calculated in two steps. The Ceiling Test as of 
June 30, 2015 comparing PV10 value of reserves to cumulative costs of evaluated 
properties (those in production or in development) resulted in Impairment 
expense of $16,406,993. The $6,031,121 balance of Impairment expense represents 
the downward adjustment in cumulative costs of unevaluated properties 
&#160;calculated by comparison of cumulative costs per books to fair value 
indicated by recent industry transactions.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left">
<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="bottom" width="15%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; 
BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Property</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; 
PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Quarter</font></div>
</td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; PADDING-
BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 
4px"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; 
BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Oil Production {BBLS}</font></div>
</td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; PADDING-
BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 
4px"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; 
BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Gas Production {MCF}</font></div>
</td>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 
2.&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND 
RESULTS OF OPERATIONS </font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">-
continued</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">We recorded depreciation, 
depletion, and amortization expense of $698,805for the six months ended June 30,
2015.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline; DISPLAY: inline">General and Administrative
Expenses</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Our general and administrative expenses for the six months 
ended June 30, 2015 and 2014 were $8,896,025 and $7,139,247, respectively. Our 
general and administrative expenses consisted of consulting and compensation 
expense, substantially all of which was non-cash or deferred, accounting and 
administrative costs, professional consulting fees, and other general corporate 
expenses. &#160;The change in general and administrative expenses for the 
quarters ended June 30, 2015 compared to 2014 is detailed </font><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">as 
follows:</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY:

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: inline">Historical Results for the 
three months ended June 30, 2015 and 2014:</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Revenues and Cost of Revenues</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">For the three months ended June 30, 2015, we had production 
revenue of $508,265 compared to $1,630,035 for the three months ended June 30,
2014. Refer to the table of production and revenue history above. &#160;Our cost
of revenue, consisting of lease operating expenses and production taxes, was 
$279,646, and $397,184 for the three months ended June 30, 2015 and 2014, 
respectively.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Our general and administrative expenses for the three months 
ended June 30, 2015 and 2014 were $8,207,314 and $1,318,179, respectively. Our 
general and administrative expenses consisted of consulting and compensation 
expense, substantially all of which was non-cash or deferred, accounting and 
administrative costs, professional consulting fees, and other general corporate 
expenses. &#160;The change in general and administrative expenses for the three

Expenses</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">$</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="20%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">6,889,135</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: 
left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">At June 30, 2015, we had working capital of 
($7,209,691), current assets of $1,194,867 consisting of cash, accounts
receivable, notes receivable, and prepaid expenses and total assets of 
$16,837,864 consisting of current assets, investments in oil and gas properties,
and other assets. As of June 30, 2015, we had current liabilities of $8,404,558,
consisting of, accounts payable (principally for development costs), payables to
related parties, notes payable, and accrued interest. Stockholders&#8217; equity
was $4,328,200.</font></div>
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">19</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 
2.&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND 
RESULTS OF OPERATIONS </font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">-
continued</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">Cash flow
provided by (used) in operating activities for the six months ended June 30, 
2015 was $1,396,266 compared to $(749,422) for the six months ended June 30, 
2014, an increase of $2,145,688. Cash flow provided by operating activities for 
the six months ended June 30, 2015 can be primarily attributed to net losses 
from operations of $33,073,738 which consists primarily of $22,438,114 of 
impairment expense, $8,896,025 in general and administrative expenses 
($7,078,791 of which is non-cash, stock based compensation), depreciation, 
depletion and amortization of $698,805, accretion of convertible note discounts 
of $1,163,091. Cash flow used in operating activities for the six months ended 
June 30, 2014 can be primarily attributed to net losses from operations of 
$10,492,604, which consists primarily of $7,139,247 in general and 
administrative expenses ($4,753,686 of which is non-cash stock based 
compensation), depreciation, depletion, and amortization of $962,703, and 
accretion of convertible note discounts $3,158,850. We expect to continue to use
cash flow in operating activities until such time as we achieve sufficient 
commercial oil and gas production to cover all of our cash costs.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">Cash flow used in investing activities for the six months ended June 30,
2015 was $3,666,825 compared to $10,843,479 for the six months ended June 30, 
2014. &#160;Cash flow used in investing activities consists primarily of oil and
gas investments in properties during the six months ended June 30, 2015 and 
2014.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">Cash flow provided by financing activities for the six months ended June
30, 2015 was $2,302,989 as compared to $10,834,759 for the six months ended June
30, 2014. &#160;Cash flow provided by financing activities consists primarily of
proceeds from promissory notes, common stock issues, and warrant exercises. 
&#160;We expect to continue to have cash flow provided by financing activities 
as we seek new rounds of financing and continue to develop our oil and gas 
investments.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">Our
current assets are insufficient to meet our current obligations or to satisfy 
our cash needs over the next twelve months and as such we will require 
additional debt or equity financing to meet our plans and needs. &#160;We face 
obstacles in continuing to attract new financing due to our history and current 
record of net losses and working capital deficits. &#160;&#160;Despite our 
efforts, we can provide no assurance that we will be able to obtain the 
financing required to meet our stated objectives or even to continue as a going 
concern.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">We 
do not expect to pay cash dividends in the foreseeable future.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Commitments and 
Contingencies</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">We are subject to contingencies as a result of 
environmental laws and regulations. Present and future environmental laws and 
regulations applicable to our operations could require substantial capital 
expenditures or could adversely affect our operations in other ways that cannot 
be predicted at this time. &#160;As of June 30 2015 and June 30, 2014, no 
amounts have been recorded because no specific liability has been identified 
that is reasonably probable of requiring us to fund any future material 
amounts.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">As of June 30, 2015 the Company had interests in five 
oil and gas projects: the Marcelina Creek Field Development in Wilson County, 
Texas, the Coulter Field in Waller County, Texas, the Ring Energy Joint Venture 
in Southwest Kansas and the Hunton play in partnership with Husky Ventures in 
Central Oklahoma and the Orogrande Project in Hudspeth County, Texas. See the 
description under &#8220;Current Projects&#8221; above 
under&#160;&#8220;Overview&#8221; for more information and disclosure regarding 
commitments and contingencies relating to these projects. &#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 3.&#160;&#160;&#160;QUANTITATIVE
AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">Not Applicable.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 4.&#160;&#160;&#160;CONTROLS AND
PROCEDURES</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Disclosure Controls and Procedures</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Under the supervision and with the participation of our 
management, including our principal executive officer and principal financial 
officer, we evaluated the effectiveness of the design and operation of our 
disclosure controls and procedures, as defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) 
under the Exchange Act, as of June 30, 2015. Based on this evaluation, our 
principal executive officer and principal financial officer concluded that, as 
of the end of the period covered by this report, our disclosure controls and 
procedures were effective to ensure that the information required to be 
disclosed by us in the reports we submit under the Exchange Act is recorded, 
processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the 
applicable rules and forms and that such information was accumulated and 
communicated to our principal executive officer and principal financial officer,
in a manner that allowed for timely decisions regarding 
disclosure.&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">Our principal executive officer and principal financial 
officer have indicated that, upon evaluation, there were no changes in our 
internal control over financial reporting or other factors during the period 
covered by this report that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely 
to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">20</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">PART II&#160;&#160;&#160;OTHER 
INFORMATION</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 1.&#160;&#160;LEGAL 
PROCEEDINGS</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">On February 16, 2012, we filed a lawsuit against Hockley 
Energy, Inc. and Frank O. Snortheim in the District Court of Harris County,
Texas in connection with farmout agreements we entered into with Hockley Energy 
in November 2011.&#160;&#160;The Company sued Hockley Energy and Snortheim for 
breach of contract, fraudulent inducement, promissory estoppel pertaining to 
failure to perform two farmout agreements entered into on November 4, 2011, the 
first relating to the Marcelina Creek prospect and the second relating to the 
East Stockdale prospect.&#160;&#160;Under the Marcelina Farmout, Hockley Energy 
had an obligation to fund $2,231,250.00 no later than November 18, 
2011.&#160;&#160;They did not perform as promised.&#160;&#160;On February 23, 
2015, the Company obtained a summary judgment against Hockley Energy in the 
amount of $16,400,000 in damages and $21,877.77 in attorney fees.&#160;&#160;We 
are currently seeking to enforce the judgment, but it is doubtful that any 
substantial portion of the judgment is recoverable from Hockley 
Energy.&#160;&#160;The remaining claims against Snortheim have been set for 
trial the two-week period beginning on October 19, 2015.&#160;&#160;There are no
counterclaims pending.&#160;&#160;Management is open to settlement 
discussions.&#160;&#160;Because there are no counterclaims, the possibility of 
an adverse outcome is remote.</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 2.&#160;&#160;UNREGISTERED SALES OF 
EQUITY SECURITIES AND USE OF PROCEEDS</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">During the three months ended June 30, 2015, we issued a total 
of 1,412,458 shares of common stock to consultants as compensation for 
services.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">In May 2015, an investor exercised a right to acquire 631,250 
shares of common stock at $.35 per share, whereby we issued 631,250 shares of 
common stock to the investor for $225,000 in cash.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">In June 2015, we issued 30,000 shares of common stock in 
connection with the modification of mineral leases for the extension of drilling
obligations.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">During the three months ended June 30, 2015, we issued a total 
of 935,750 warrants as compensation for services, including 85,750 five year 
warrant in April 2015 with an exercise price of $2.50 per share, and 850,000 
five year warrants in June 2015 with an exercise price of $1.80 per 
share.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">During the three months ended June 30, 2015, we issued a total 
of 670,000 warrants (of which 590,000 vested) in connection with short term 
loans, including 400,000 three year warrants in May 2015 with an exercise price 
of $0.50 per share, 120,000 three year warrants (of which 40,000 vested, see 
Item 5 &#8220;Other Information&#8221; below) in June 2015 with an exercise 
price of $2.29 per share, and 150,000 three year warrants in April 2015 with an 
exercise price of $0.50 per share.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">In May 2015, we issued 250,000 three year warrants in 
connection with the sale of a mineral interest.&#160;&#160;The warrants have an 
exercise price of $0.50 per share.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">In June 2015, we granted a total of 7,950,000 stock option 
awards, including 7,500,000 stock options to executive officers with an exercise
price of $1.57 per share and 450,000 stock options to employees with an exercise
price of $1.79 per share.&#160;&#160;The options were granted under our 2015 
Stock Option Plan which plan was approved by the Board of Directors in June 2015
and will be presented for approval to our stockholders at the upcoming 2015 
annual meeting.&#160;&#160;The options have a term of five years.&#160;&#160;The
options will be subject to a two-year vesting schedule with one-half vesting 
immediately (subject to stockholders approving the 2015 Stock Option Plan), one-
fourth vesting after one year of the grant date, and the remaining one-fourth 
vesting after the second year, provided however that the options will be subject
to earlier vesting under certain events set forth in the 2015 Stock Option Plan,
including without limitation a change in control.&#160;&#160;Further, the 
options cannot be exercised prior to obtaining stockholder approval of the 2015 
Stock Option Plan, and the options will be cancelled if stockholder approval is 
not obtained.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">All of the above sales of securities described in this Item 2 
were sold under the exemption from registration provided by Section 4(a)(2) of 
the Securities Act of 1933 and the rules and regulations promulgated 
thereunder.&#160;&#160;The issuances of securities did not involve a 
&#8220;public offering&#8221; based upon the following factors: (i) the 
issuances of securities were isolated private transactions; (ii) a limited 
number of securities were issued to a&#160;limited number of purchasers; (iii) 
there were no public solicitations; (iv) the investment intent of the 
purchasers; and (v) the restriction on transferability of the securities 
issued.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ITEM 5.&#160;&#160;OTHER 
INFORMATION</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">On November 4, 2014, Eunis L. Shockey loaned us $500,000 under 
a 30-day promissory note.&#160; The promissory note accrues interest at an 
annual rate of 10%.&#160; We did not make payment on the note on the December 4,
2014 maturity date.&#160; As consideration for defaulting on the note and for 
Mr. Shockey agreeing to extend the note, we issued 400,000 warrants to Mr. 
Shockey on May 4, 2015.&#160; The warrants have a term of three years and an 
exercise price of $0.50 per share.&#160; On May 14, 2015, we repaid $100,000 of 
the note, reducing the principal balance to $400,000.&#160; On June 30, 2015, we
issued 120,000 warrants to Mr. Shockey as consideration for agreeing to extend 
the promissory note to December 31, 2015. 40,000 of the warrants vested 
immediately with the remaining 80,000 warrants being unvested. The warrants have
a term of three years and an exercise price of $2.29 per share.&#160; Under the 
terms of the extension, if the note is not earlier prepaid, an additional 40,000
of the warrants vest on September 30, 2015 and the remaining 40,000 warrants 
vest on December 31, 2015.&#160; In the event that a portion of the note is 
paid, then the number of warrants, which remain subject to vesting, will be 
reduced pro rata. &#160;<font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; DISPLAY: inline">(The 
disclosure regarding these transactions found under the heading &#8220;Certain 
Relationships and Related Transactions&#8221; in our Definitive Proxy Statement 
filed with the SEC on August 6, 2015 inaccurately reflects the exercise price of
the warrants issued on June 30, 2015.)</font></font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">&#160;</div>

<DESCRIPTION>12% SERIES B UNSECURED CONVERTIBLE PROMISSORY NOTE (FORM OF)
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
    <title>exhibit_10-12.htm</title>

    <!--Document Created using EDGARizerAgent 5.5.0.0-->
