<body bgcolor="#ffffff" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">
<div>
<hr style="COLOR: black" align="left" noshade size="2" width="100%">
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Exhibit 31.2</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF 
THE</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;&#160;</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">I, <font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline; DISPLAY: 
inline">Roger Wurtele</font>, certify that:</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">1. I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-Q of 
Torchlight Energy Resources, Inc. for the period ended June 30,
2015;</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">2.&#160;&#160;Based on my knowledge, this report does not 
contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact
necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which
such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by 
this report;</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">3.&#160;&#160;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, 
and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all 
material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows 
of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this 
report;</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">4. The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are 
responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures 
(as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15 (e) and 15d- 15 (e)) and internal 
control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and
15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;a)&#160;&#160;Designed such 
disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and 
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that 
material&#160;&#160;information relating to the small&#160;&#160;business 
issuer, including its consolidated subsidiary, is made known to us by others 
within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is 
being prepared;</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;b) Designed such internal control
over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial 
reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance 
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of 
financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted
accounting principles;</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;c) Evaluated the effectiveness of
the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures, and presented in this 
report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and 
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such 
evaluation; and</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;d)&#160;&#160;Disclosed in this 
report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting 
that occurred during the registrant's fourth quarter that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's 
internal control over the financial reporting; and</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">5. I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of 
internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the 
audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing 
the equivalent functions):</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;a) All significant deficiencies 
and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over 
financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the 
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial 
information; and</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;b) Any fraud, whether or not 
material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant 
role in the registrant's internal control over financial 
reporting.</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">/s/ Roger Wurtele</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div>
<hr style="COLOR: black" align="left" noshade size="2" width="15%">
</div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">By: Roger Wurtele,</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Chief Financial Officer</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">(Principal <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New
Roman">Financial Officer)</font></font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New

14, 2015</font></font></font></font></div>

<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND PRINCIPAL 
FINANCIAL OFFICER PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002 AND 
SECTION 1350 OF 18 U.S.C. 63.

</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Exhibit 32.1</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 906</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">I, <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">John A. Brda</font>, certify pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 
1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that
the&#160;quarterly report on Form 10-Q of Torchlight Energy Resources, Inc. for 
the period ended June 30, 2015, fully complies with the requirements of Section 
13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and that information 
contained in such&#160;quarterly report on Form 10-Q fairly presents, in all 
material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of 
Torchlight Energy Resources, Inc.</font></font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT:

the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (&#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;), 
and is not to be incorporated by reference into any filing of Torchlight Energy 
Resources, Inc. under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange 
Act, whether made before or after the date hereof, regardless of any general 
incorporation language in such filing.</font></font></div>

    <us-gaap:NatureOfOperations contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Torchlight Energy 
Resources, Inc. was incorporated in October 2007&#13;under the laws of the State
of Nevada as Pole Perfect Studios, Inc. 
(&amp;#147;PPS&amp;#148;).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;From its incorporation to 
November&#13;2010, the company was primarily engaged in business start-up 
activities.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On November 23, 2010, we entered into and
closed a Share Exchange&#13;Agreement (the &amp;#147;Exchange 
Agreement&amp;#148;) between the major shareholders of PPS and the shareholders 
of Torchlight Energy,&#13;Inc. (&amp;#147;TEI&amp;#148;).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As 
a result of the transactions effected by the Exchange Agreement, at closing TEI 
became&#13;our wholly-owned subsidiary, and the business of TEI became our sole 
business.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;TEI was incorporated under the laws of&#13;the 
State of Nevada in June 2010.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;We are engaged in the 
acquisition, exploitation and/or development of oil and natural&#13;gas 
properties in the United States.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In addition to TEI, we also 
operate our business through our wholly-owned subsidiaries&#13;Torchlight Energy
Operating, LLC, a Texas limited liability company and Hudspeth Oil Corporation, 
a Texas corporation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On December 10, 2010, we effected a
4-for-1 forward split of our&#13;shares of common stock 
outstanding.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All owners of record at the close of business on
December 10, 2010 (record date)&#13;received three additional shares for every 
one share they owned.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All share amounts reflected throughout 
this report&#13;take into account the 4-for-1 forward 
split.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Effective February 8, 2011, we changed our 
name to &amp;#147;Torchlight&#13;Energy Resources, 
Inc.&amp;#148;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In connection with the name change, our ticker
symbol changed from &amp;#147;PPFT&amp;#148;&#13;to 
&amp;#147;TRCH.&amp;#148;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company is 
engaged in the acquisition, exploration, development&#13;and production of oil 
and gas properties within the United States. The Company&amp;#146;s success will
depend in large part on its&#13;ability to obtain and develop profitable oil and
gas interests.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NatureOfOperations>
    <us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in 
accordance&#13;with generally accepted accounting principles applicable to a 
going concern, which assumes that the Company will be able to meet&#13;its 
obligations and continue its operations for its next fiscal
year.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;At June 30, 2015, the Company had not yet 
achieved profitable operations.&#13;We had a net loss of approximately $33.1 
million for the six months ended June 30, 2015 and had accumulated losses of 
$64,724,298&#13;since our inception to June 30, 2015, and expects to incur 
further losses in the development of our 
business.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Working&#13;Capital as of June 30, 2015 was 
negative $7,209,691. The Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going 
concern is dependent on&#13;its ability to generate future profitable operations
and/or to obtain the necessary financing to meet its obligations and 
repay&#13;its liabilities arising from normal business operations when they come
due.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Management&amp;#146;s plan to address the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;ability to continue as a going concern 
includes:&amp;#160;&amp;#160;(1) obtaining debt or equity funding from private 
placement or institutional&#13;sources; (2) obtain loans from financial 
institutions, where possible, or (3) participating in joint venture transactions
with&#13;third parties.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Although management believes that it 
will be able to obtain the necessary funding to allow the Company&#13;to remain 
a going concern through the methods discussed above, there can be no assurances 
that such methods will prove successful.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;accompanying
consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments that might 
result from the outcome of this uncertainty.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Planned Divestiture of Hunton 
Project&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On April 8, 2015, management 
announced&#13;that they are seeking to divest certain of our Hunton assets 
located in Logan and Kingfisher Counties, 
Oklahoma.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Negotiations&#13;for a potential sale are ongoing 
at this time.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The 
Company&#13;maintains its accounts on the accrual method of accounting in 
accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the&#13;United 
States of America. Accounting principles followed and the methods of applying 
those principles, which materially affect&#13;the determination of financial 
position, results of operations and cash flows are summarized 
below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Use&#13;of 
estimates&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The preparation of financial statements
in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted&#13;in the United 
States of America requires management to make estimates and certain assumptions 
that affect the amounts reported&#13;in these consolidated financial statements 
and accompanying notes. Actual results could differ from these 
estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis&#13;of 
presentation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&amp;#151;The financial statements are presented
on a consolidated basis and include all of the accounts of&#13;Torchlight Energy
Resources Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiaries, Torchlight Energy, Inc.,
Torchlight Energy Operating, LLC,&#13;and Hudspeth Oil Corporation. All 
significant intercompany balances and transactions have been 
eliminated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Risks&#13;and 
uncertainties&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The Company&amp;#146;s operations 
are subject to significant risks and uncertainties, including 
financial,&#13;operational, technological, and other risks associated with 
operating an emerging business, including the potential risk of 
business&#13;failure.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Concentration&#13;of risks&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; 
&amp;#150; The Company&amp;#146;s cash is placed with a highly rated financial 
institution, and the Company periodically&#13;reviews the credit worthiness of 
the financial institutions with which it does business. At times the 
Company&amp;#146;s cash balances&#13;are in excess of amounts guaranteed by the 
Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair&#13;value of financial 
instruments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; Financial instruments consist of 
cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable, notes&#13;payable to related party,
and convertible promissory notes. The estimated fair values of cash, accounts 
receivable, accounts payable,&#13;and related party payables approximate the 
carrying amount due to the relatively short maturity of these instruments. The 
carrying&#13;amounts of the convertible promissory notes approximate their fair 
value giving affect for the term of the note and the effective&#13;interest 
rates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;For assets&#13;and liabilities that require re-
measurement to fair value the Company categorizes them in a three-level fair 
value hierarchy as&#13;follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#183;Level&#13;1 inputs are quoted prices 
(unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or 
liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#183;Level&#13;2 inputs are quoted prices for similar 
assets and liabilities in active markets or inputs that are observable for the 
asset or&#13;liability, either directly or indirectly through market 
corroboration.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#183;Level&#13;3 inputs are unobservable inputs based on 
management&amp;#146;s own assumptions used to measure assets and liabilities at 
fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;A financial&#13;asset or liability&amp;#146;s 
classification within the hierarchy is determined based on the lowest level 
input that is significant&#13;to the fair value
measurement.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounts&#13;receivable and 
Production revenue receivable&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; Accounts receivable
consist of uncollateralized oil and natural gas&#13;revenues due under normal 
trade terms, as well as amounts due from working interest owners of oil and gas 
properties for their&#13;share of expenses paid on their behalf by the Company. 
Management reviews receivables periodically and reduces the carrying 
amount&#13;by a valuation allowance that reflects management&amp;#146;s best 
estimate of the amount that may not be collectible. As of June 30,&#13;2015 and 
December 31, 2014 no valuation allowance was considered 
necessary.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Investment&#13;in oil and gas 
properties&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The Company uses the full cost method 
of accounting for exploration and development activities&#13;as defined by the 
Securities and Exchange Commission (&amp;#147;SEC&amp;#148;). Under this method 
of accounting, the costs of unsuccessful,&#13;as well as successful, exploration
and development activities are capitalized as properties and equipment. This 
includes any internal&#13;costs that are directly related to property 
acquisition, exploration and development activities but does not include any 
costs&#13;related to production, general corporate overhead or similar 
activities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Oil and gas&#13;properties include costs that are 
excluded from costs being depleted or amortized. Oil and natural gas property 
costs excluded&#13;represent investments in unevaluated properties and include 
non-producing leasehold, geological, and geophysical costs associated&#13;with 
leasehold or drilling interests and exploration drilling costs. The Company 
allocates a portion of its acquisition costs&#13;to unevaluated properties based
on relative value. Costs are transferred to the full cost pool as the properties
are evaluated&#13;over the life of the 
reservoir.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt
;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Capitalized&#13;interest
 &amp;#150; &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;The Company capitalizes interest on unevaluated 
properties during the periods in which they are excluded&#13;from costs being 
depleted or amortized.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;During the periods ended June 30, 2015
and December 31, 2014, the Company capitalized&#13;$395,738 and $371,116, 
respectively, of interest on unevaluated 
properties.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Depreciation,&#13;depletion, and 
amortization&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The depreciable base for oil and 
natural gas properties includes the sum of all capitalized&#13;costs net of 
accumulated depreciation, depletion, and amortization 
(&amp;#147;DD&amp;#38;A&amp;#148;), estimated future development costs&#13;and 
asset retirement costs not included in oil and natural gas properties, less 
costs excluded from amortization. The depreciable&#13;base of oil and natural 
gas properties is amortized on a unit-of-production 
method.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Ceiling&#13;test&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; 
Future production volumes from oil and gas properties are a significant factor 
in determining the full cost&#13;ceiling limitation of capitalized costs. Under 
the full cost method of accounting, the Company is required to periodically 
perform&#13;a &amp;#147;ceiling test&amp;#148; that determines a limit on the 
book value of oil and gas properties. If the net capitalized cost of&#13;proved 
oil and gas properties, net of related deferred income taxes, plus the cost of 
unproved oil and gas properties, exceeds&#13;the present value of estimated 
future net cash flows discounted at 10 percent, net of related tax affects, plus
the cost of unproved&#13;oil and gas properties, the excess is charged to 
expense and reflected as additional accumulated DD&amp;#38;A. The ceiling test 
calculation&#13;uses a commodity price assumption which is based on the 
unweighted arithmetic average of the price on the first day of each 
month&#13;for each month within the prior 12 month period and excludes future 
cash outflows related to estimated abandonment costs. The&#13;Company recognized
impairment of $22,438,114 on its oil and gas properties during the three months 
ended June 30, 2015. No impairment&#13;was recognized at December 31, 2014. Due 
to the volatility of commodity prices, should oil and natural gas prices decline
in the&#13;future, it is possible that an additional write-down could occur. 
Proved reserves are estimated quantities of crude&amp;#160;oil,&#13;natural gas,
and natural gas liquids, which geological and engineering data demonstrate with 
reasonable certainty to be recoverable&#13;from known reservoirs under existing 
economic and operating conditions. The independent engineering estimates include
only those&#13;amounts considered to be proved reserves and do not include 
additional amounts which may result from new discoveries in the future,&#13;or 
from application of secondary and tertiary recovery processes where facilities 
are not in place or for which transportation&#13;and/or marketing contracts are 
not in place. Estimated reserves to be developed through secondary or tertiary 
recovery processes&#13;are classified as unevaluated 
properties.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The determination&#13;of oil and gas reserves is a 
subjective process, and the accuracy of any reserve estimate depends on the 
quality of available&#13;data and the application of engineering and geological 
interpretation and judgment. Estimates of economically recoverable 
reserves&#13;and future net cash flows depend on a number of variable factors 
and assumptions that are difficult to predict and may vary considerably&#13;from
actual results. In particular, reserve estimates for wells with limited or no 
production history are less reliable than those&#13;based on actual production. 
Subsequent re-evaluation of reserves and cost estimates related to future 
development of proved oil&#13;and gas reserves could result in significant 
revisions to proved reserves.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Other issues, such as changes 
in regulatory&#13;requirements, technological advances, and other factors which 
are difficult to predict could also affect estimates of proved reserves&#13;in 
the future.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Gains and&#13;losses on the sale of oil and gas 
properties are not generally reflected in income. Sales of less than 100% of the
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;interest in the oil and gas property are treated as a 
reduction of the capital cost of the field, with no gain or loss 
recognized,&#13;as long as doing so does not significantly affect the unit-of-
production depletion rate. Costs of retired equipment, net of salvage&#13;value,
are usually charged to accumulated 
depreciation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Asset&#13;retirement 
obligations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; Accounting principles require that 
the fair value of a liability for an asset&amp;#146;s retirement&#13;obligation 
(&amp;#147;ARO&amp;#148;) be recorded in the period in which it is incurred if a
reasonable estimate of fair value can be made,&#13;and that the corresponding 
cost be capitalized as part of the carrying amount of the related long-lived 
asset. The liability is&#13;accreted to its then-present value each subsequent 
period, and the capitalized cost is depleted over the useful life of the 
related&#13;asset. Abandonment cost incurred is recorded as a reduction to the 
ARO liability.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Inherent in&#13;the fair value calculation of an ARO
are numerous assumptions and judgments including the ultimate settlement 
amounts, inflation&#13;factors, credit adjusted discount rates, timing of 
settlement, and changes in the legal, regulatory, environmental, and 
political&#13;environments. To the extent future revisions to these assumptions 
impact the fair value of the existing ARO liability, a 
corresponding&#13;adjustment is made to the oil and gas property balance. 
Settlements greater than or less than amounts accrued as ARO are recorded&#13;as
a gain or loss upon settlement.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Asset retirement&#13;obligation activity is disclosed in
Note 10.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Share-based&#13;compensation 
&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&amp;#150; Compensation cost for equity awards is based on 
the fair value of the equity instrument on the date&#13;of grant and is 
recognized over the period during which an employee is required to provide 
service in exchange for the award.&#13;Compensation cost for liability awards is
based on the fair value of the vested award at the end of each 
period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Revenue&#13;recognition&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; 
&amp;#150; The Company recognizes oil and gas revenues when production is sold 
at a fixed or determinable price,&#13;persuasive evidence of an arrangement 
exists, delivery has occurred and title has transferred, and collectability is 
reasonably&#13;assured.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt
;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
 style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basic&#13;and diluted earnings (loss) per 
share&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;i&gt; &amp;#150; &lt;/i&gt;Basic earnings (loss) 
per common share is computed by dividing net&#13;income (loss) available to 
common shareholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding 
during the period.&#13;Diluted earnings (loss) per common share is computed in 
the same way as basic earnings (loss) per common share except that 
the&#13;denominator is increased to include the number of additional common 
shares that would be outstanding if all potential common shares&#13;had been 
issued and if the additional common shares were dilutive.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The
Company has not included potentially dilutive&#13;securities in the calculation
of loss per share for any periods presented as the effects would be anti-
dilutive.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Environmental&#13;laws and 
regulations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The Company is subject to extensive 
federal, state, and local environmental laws and regulations.&#13;Environmental 
expenditures are expensed or capitalized depending on their future economic 
benefit. The Company believes that it&#13;is in compliance with existing laws 
and regulations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recent&#13;accounting 
pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; 
&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On August&#13;27, 2014, the FASB issued ASU 2014-15, 
which provides guidance on determining when and how to disclose going-concern 
uncertainties&#13;in the financial statements. The new standard requires 
management to perform interim and annual assessments of the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;ability to continue as a going concern within one year of
the date the financial statements are issued. An entity must provide&#13;certain
disclosures if conditions or events raise substantial doubt about the 
entity&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going concern.&#13;The ASU applies to
all entities and is effective for annual periods ending after December 15, 2016,
and interim periods thereafter,&#13;with early adoption 
permitted.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;In May 2014,&#13;the FASB issued ASU 2014-09 that 
introduces a new five-step revenue recognition model in which an entity should 
recognize revenue&#13;to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to 
customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the 
entity&#13;expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. This 
ASU also requires disclosures sufficient to enable users&#13;to understand the 
nature, amount, timing, and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows arising from 
contracts with customers, including&#13;qualitative and quantitative disclosures
about contracts with customers, significant judgments and changes in judgments, 
and assets&#13;recognized from the costs to obtain or fulfill a contract. This 
standard is effective for fiscal years beginning after December&#13;15, 2017, 
including interim periods within that reporting period. The Company is currently
evaluating the new guidance to determine&#13;the impact it will have on its 
consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;In April 2014,&#13;the FASB issued ASU 2014-08, which 
includes amendments that change the requirements for reporting discontinued 
operations and&#13;require additional disclosures about discontinued operations.
Under the new guidance, only disposals representing a strategic&#13;shift in 
operations - that is, a major effect on the organization&amp;#146;s operations 
and financial results should be presented&#13;as discontinued operations. 
Additionally, the ASU requires expanded disclosures about discontinued 
operations that will provide&#13;financial statement users with more information
about the assets, liabilities, income, and expenses of discontinued
operations.&#13;The new standard is effective in the first quarter of 2015 for 
public organizations with calendar year ends. Early adoption would&#13;be 
permitted for any annual or interim period for which an entity&amp;#146;s 
financial statements have not yet been made available&#13;for issuance. The 
adoption of this guidance is not expected to have an impact on the 
Company&amp;#146;s consolidated financial 
statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Other recently&#13;issued or adopted accounting 
pronouncements are not expected to have, or did not have, a material impact on 
the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;financial position or results from 
operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Subsequent&#13;events &amp;#150; 
&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;The Company evaluated subsequent events through August 14, 
2015, the date of issuance of the financial statements.&#13;Subsequent events 
are disclosed in Note 11.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-
01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin:
0"&gt;As of June 30, 2015, related party payables consisted of accrued&#13;and 
unpaid compensation to two of our executive officers totaling 
$90,000.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company is subject to contingencies as a result 
of environmental&#13;laws and regulations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Present and future
environmental laws and regulations applicable to the Company&amp;#146;s 
operations&#13;could require substantial capital expenditures or could adversely
affect its operations in other ways that cannot be predicted&#13;at this 
time.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of June 30, 2015, no amounts had been recorded 
because no specific liability has been identified that&#13;is reasonably 
probable of requiring the Company to fund any future material 
amounts.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company has authorized 10,000,000 shares of 
preferred stock with par value of $.001.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;On&#13;June 9, 2015, under a Securities Purchase Agreement, we sold to
certain accredited investors an aggregate of $9,800,000 in shares&#13;of Series 
A Convertible Preferred Stock, amounting to a total of 98,000 shares of the 
Series A Convertible Preferred Stock at&#13;a purchase price of $100 per 
share.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The designations, preferences, limitations, 
restrictions and relative rights of&#13;the Series A Convertible Preferred Stock
are as follows: (i) a stated value of $100 per share; (ii) mandatory conversion 
one year&#13;after issuance (provided no insolvency event has occurred and 
subject to the restriction described in the following clause &amp;#147;
(iv)&amp;#148;),&#13;with each holder having the right to convert at its 
election any time before that; (iii) a conversion price of $1.15 per 
shares&#13;of common stock; (iv) until stockholder approval is obtained, holders
may not convert (and there shall not be any mandatory conversion)&#13;if such 
conversion will result in such holder beneficially owning in excess of 19.9% of
our common stock; (v) a dividend in an&#13;annual amount equal to 12% on the 
outstanding stated value of each share payable in common stock or cash at the 
holder&amp;#146;s&#13;election; (vi) each holder shall be entitled to the number
of votes equal to the number of shares of common stock into which 
such&#13;shares of Series A Convertible Preferred Stock could be converted; 
(vii) in the event of any voluntary or involuntary liquidation,&#13;dissolution 
or winding up, the holders will be entitled to be paid out of the assets 
available for distribution to our stockholders,&#13;before any payment is be 
made to the holders of common stock; and (viii) the holders will have the right 
to participate in up&#13;to 100%, in the aggregate, on a pro-rata basis, of any 
subsequent private placement offerings by us of our equity securities,&#13;on 
identical terms and conditions as set forth in such subsequent offering for so 
long as the holder owns the Series A Convertible&#13;Preferred 
Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;preferred investors were provided 20% warrant coverage. A 
total of 1,704,346 warrants were issued with a five-year term and 
an&#13;exercise price of $1.40 per share of common stock. The warrants also 
provide that, until stockholder approval is obtained, holders&#13;may not 
exercise if such exercise will result in such holder beneficially owning in 
excess of 19.9% of our common stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;At&#13;closing of the Securities Purchase 
Agreement, proceeds from the offering were used to pay off, in full, the holders
of the 12%&#13;Series A Secured Convertible Promissory Notes (the 
&amp;#147;Senior Notes&amp;#148;), subject to the release of all liens and 
security&#13;interests.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:

8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;During&#13;the three months ended June 30,
2015 the Company issued 1,412,458 shares of common stock as compensation for 
services, with a&#13;total value of 
$1,689,371.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times

Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;At&#13;June 30, 2015 the 
Company had reserved 17,847,868 common shares for future exercise of warrants 
plus 8,521,739 common shares for&#13;future conversion of issued preferred 
stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;Warrants&#13;issued in relation to the promissory notes issued (see 
note 9) were valued using the Black Scholes Option Pricing Model. The 
assumptions&#13;used in calculating the fair value of the warrants issued are as
follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,

    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;Income taxes are accounted for under the asset&#13;and liability 
method.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized 
for the future tax consequences attributable&#13;to differences between the 
financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and 
their respective tax bases&#13;and operating loss carry 
forwards.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured 
using enacted tax rates expected&#13;to apply to taxable income in the years in 
which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or 
settled.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;effect on deferred tax assets and 
liabilities of a change in tax rates is recognized in income in the period that 
includes the&#13;enactment date.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A valuation allowance is 
established to reduce deferred tax assets if it is more likely than not 
that&#13;the related tax benefits will not be realized.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The 
Company has placed a 100% valuation allowance against the net deferred&#13;tax 
asset because future realization of these assets is not
assured.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Authoritative guidance for 
uncertainty in income&#13;taxes requires that the Company recognize the 
financial statement benefit of a tax position only after determining that the 
relevant&#13;tax authority would more likely than not sustain the position 
following an examination.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Management has reviewed 
the&#13;Company&amp;#146;s tax positions and determined there were no uncertain 
tax positions requiring recognition in the consolidated 
financial&#13;statements.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#146;s tax returns 
remain subject to Federal and State tax examinations for all tax years 
since&#13;inception as none of the statutes have 
expired.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Generally, the applicable statutes of limitation are
three to four years&#13;from their respective filings.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Estimated interest and 
penalties related to&#13;potential underpayment on any unrecognized tax benefits
are classified as a component of tax expense in the statement of 
operation.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;Company has not recorded any interest or 
penalties associated with unrecognized tax benefits for any periods covered by 
these financial&#13;statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company had a net deferred 
tax asset related&#13;to federal net operating loss carryforwards of $30,014,914
and $24,089,942 at June 30, 2015 and December 31, 2014, 
respectively.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;federal net operating loss carryforward
will begin to expire in 2030.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Realization of the deferred tax
asset is dependent,&#13;in part, on generating sufficient taxable income prior 
to expiration of the loss carryforwards.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company has 
placed&#13;a 100% valuation allowance against the net deferred tax asset because
future realization of these assets is not assured.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:MortgageNotesPayableDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0;
text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Series&#13;&amp;#147;A&amp;#148; Convertible 
Promissory Notes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;December 18, 2012, the
Company exchanged $412,500 of outstanding convertible promissory notes for new 
12% Series A Secured Convertible&#13;Promissory Notes (&amp;#147;Series A 
Notes&amp;#148;) described below.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Series A Notes were 
issued as part of a larger offering&#13;with senior liens on the 
Company&amp;#146;s oil and gas properties.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In order to induce
the holders of the previously outstanding&#13;convertible promissory notes to 
exchange such promissory notes and to relinquish their priority liens on the 
Company&amp;#146;s oil&#13;and gas properties in favor of all 12% Convertible 
Promissory Note Holders, the Company agreed to grant the note holders a 
total&#13;of 235,714 four year warrants to purchase common stock at $1.75 per 
share, valued at $240,428, and 235,714 four year warrants&#13;to purchase common
stock at $2.00 per share, valued at $233,357.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The total of 
these warrants, $473,785, is reflected&#13;as debt issuance costs on the balance
sheet as of December 31, 2012, as these costs relate to the larger offering of 
12% Convertible&#13;Promissory Notes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;On December 18, 2012, the Company issued $690,000 of 
Series A Notes to new investors.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Together with the
conversion&#13;described above, there was $1,102,500 of principal amount 
outstanding as of December 31, 2012.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Series A Notes 
are&#13;due and payable on March 31, 2015 and provide for conversion into common
stock at a price of $1.75 per share and include the issuance&#13;of 8,000 
warrants for each $70,000 of principal amount purchase.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The 
warrants carry a five year term and have an exercise&#13;price of $2.00 per 
share.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;They were valued at $137,340, which is reflected as a 
discount on the Series A Notes, to&#13;be amortized over the life of the debt 
under the effective interest method.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Since the conversion 
price on the Series&#13;A Notes was below the market price of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock on the date of issuance, this constitutes a 
beneficial conversion&#13;feature.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The amount is calculated 
as the difference between the market price of the common stock on the date of 
closing&#13;and the effective conversion price as adjusted by the discount for 
the warrants issued.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The amount of the 
beneficial&#13;conversion feature was $390,600, and is also reflected as a 
discount on the Series A Notes.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The fair value of the 
Convertible&#13;Promissory Notes is determined utilizing Level 2 measurements in
the fair value hierarchy.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;During&#13;the year ended 
December 31, 2013, the Company issued an additional $10,895,773 in principal 
value of Series A Notes.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Such&#13;notes carry the same terms 
as described above.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In connection therewith, the Company also
issued a total of 1,308,082&#13;five-year warrants to purchase common stock at 
an exercise price of $2.00 per share.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The value of the 
warrant shares&#13;was $1,917,158 and the amount recorded for the beneficial 
conversion feature was $5,770,654.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These amounts were 
recorded&#13;as a discount on the Series A Notes.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In 
addition, the Company engaged a placement agent to source investors for 
the&#13;majority of these additional notes.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This placement 
agent was paid a fee of 10% of the principal amount of the notes&#13;plus a non-
accountable expense reimbursement of up to 2% of the principal raised by the 
agent.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The placement agent&#13;also received 552,057 warrants
to purchase common shares at $2.00 per share for a period of three years, valued
at $614,163.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All&#13;the amounts paid to the placement agent 
have been included in debt issuance costs and will be amortized into interest 
expense&#13;over the life of the Series A 
Notes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;The Series A Notes had a first 
priority lien on all of the assets of the 
Company.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;The Series 
&amp;#147;A&amp;#148; Convertible Notes total outstanding principal balance of 
$8,117,598 plus interest, was due in full at&#13;their maturity date of March 
31, 2015. &amp;#160;On June 9, 2015, under a Securities Purchase Agreement, we 
sold to certain accredited&#13;investors an aggregate of $9,800,000 in shares of
Series A Convertible Preferred Stock. Proceeds from the offering were used 
to&#13;pay off, in full, the holders of the 12% Series A Secured Convertible 
Promissory Notes (the &amp;#147;Senior Notes&amp;#148;), subject&#13;to the 
release of all liens and security 
interests.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Series&#13;&amp;#147;B&amp;#148; Convertible Subordinated
Promissory Notes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;During&#13;the quarter ended 
June 30, 2014, the Company issued&amp;#160;$3,197,500 in principal value of 12% 
Series B Convertible Unsecured Promissory&#13;Notes. The Series B Notes are due 
and payable on June 30, 2017 and provide for conversion into common stock at a 
price of $4.50&#13;per share and included the issuance of one warrant for each 
$22.50 of principal amount purchased.&amp;#160; The Company issued a 
total&#13;of 142,111 of these five-year warrants to purchase common stock at an 
exercise price of $6.00 per share. &amp;#160;The value of the&#13;warrant shares
was $405,016 and the amount recorded for the beneficial conversion feature was 
$195,466. &amp;#160;These amounts were&#13;recorded as a discount on the Series 
B Notes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;During&#13;the quarter ended September 30, 2014, the Company issued an
additional $1,372,000 in principal value of Series B Convertible 
Unsecured&#13;Promissory Notes. The Series B Notes are due and payable on June 
30, 2017 and provide for conversion into common stock at a price&#13;of $4.50 
per share and included the issuance of one warrant for each $22.50 of principal 
amount purchased.&amp;#160; The Company issued&#13;a total of 60,974 of these 
five-year warrants to purchase common stock at an exercise price of $6.00 per 
share. &amp;#160;The value&#13;of the warrant shares was $157,388 and the amount
recorded for the beneficial conversion feature was $-0-. &amp;#160;These 
amounts&#13;were recorded as a discount on the Series B Notes. The Company 
previously offered a reset of the conversion price downward to&#13;$1.00 to 
holders of the Series &amp;#147;B&amp;#148; Notes in exchange for a deferral of 
payment of accrued interest due on the Notes&#13;until December 31, 2015. 
Holders of notes totaling $2,000,000 of the total outstanding of $4,569,500 
participated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,
